result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua J Christiaansen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and costs to be paid $100.00 per month commencing 08/15/2022 and each month thereafter or penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua J Christiaansen

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

08:36 AM; Case called for Pre-trial conference. Defendant Joshua J Christiaansen in court.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court conducts colloquy with the defendant regarding his waiver of right to counsel.  Court finds the defendant is knowingly, intelligently, and knowingly waiving his right to an attorney.  Court confirms with the defendant he wants to proceed with plea and sentencing today.  Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1,  Court finds defendant guilty.  Sentencing arguments made by the State.  

COUNT 1:
The Court Orders the Following:

FINE: $694.00;
	
DNA Surcharge: $200.00;

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid at the rate of $100.00  per month commencing 08/15/2022.   Failure to pay: will result in a civil judgment.
Pre-trial conference on July 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

09:19 AM Defendant Joshua J Christiaansen in court.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
